comments.commentBody: To whom should we hold our state leaders accountable? To the corrupt republican held congress or to Mitch McConnell, the corrupt leader? How bout the rigged supreme court?
It is 2016. There is absolutely no excuse for this, and voters should hold their leaders accountable. Bring the Voting Rights Act back, now.

Either it was practice, and sadly that might be true, we'll see what happens in the general election.  Or, could it have been, given that this is a primary election,  a certain Democrat benefited from certain groups of Democrats not being able to vote and the same for the Republicans?  Given some of the early announcements while voting was still going on, that might just be the case.

@bjhamel,
Well, unfortunately that "all" is rather potent stuff. I hope Attny Gen. Lynch will investigate; I hope there'll be serious consequences for this, well beyond just firing people. And the first place she should consider digging is SCOTUS.

3-25-16@2:54 am
Republicans control the elections in Arizona.
Looks like Arizona was using the primary as a practise round for Voter Suppression.  That is all they have left.
@T:  Well, that's gonna backfire spectacularly on them this time.
That would make sense in the general, but this was a Dem primary.
Preventing people from successfully voting generally favors Republicans.  'Nuff said.
That's what they wanted and they got it.  If they didn't want it they should have learned, don't ever vote for a Republican.

@C,
Deeply ashamed, a crying shame. Shame is in short supply on the Court. Amorality is not.

3-25-16@2:48 am

The Supreme Court should be deeply ashamed of
the impact of Shelby v. Holder. Oops Justice Roberts! Apparently institutionalized racism still exists in the United States of America. We Americans would do well to remember the words of the Declaration of Independence and heed the manner of Dr. King. The Republican usurpation of power through the Supreme Court (McDonnell should be arrested for sedition at this point) and the gerrymandering of the Legislative Branch is an outrage to the Constitution. Americans are being held hostage by this disgraceful cabal of anti-intellectuals, anti-women, anti-science, racist, xenophobic (the hypocrisy knows no bounds), Christian zealots and it's a crying shame.

Who would benefit from keeping Maricopa County voters from voting?
Voters were not choosing between Hillary or Trump.

@Hdb,
I've seen several videos like this. It's horrible.

3-25-16@2:27 am

This article from azcentral.com has an infographic in the middle of the page that shows clearly that the distribution of polling centers was unfair. It looks like an intentional plan to prevent Maricopa county voters from voting.
http://www.azcentral.com/story/news/politics/elections/2016/03/23/marico...
In California the Dems are (mostly) in control and we don't wait in line to vote, but the Dems are for voter participation...

@jljarvis,
Yep. You beat me to it. So much for the U.S. as a global example of and leader in democracy. We are a nation of hubris and hypocrisy.

3-25-16@1:45 am

Shameful.

Really elevates us on the world stage, as a paragon of democratic virtue.

"the Republicans want, to make us into a third world country"

Looking at the state of our infrastructure, rail system, decreasing quality of life for all but the 1%, and soaring income inequality, I'd say that it's past tense--they've ALREADY made us a third world nation!

One has to be a three legged sloth hanging from a tree in Myanmar not to know what the Republicans are and what they will do. So why do the hapless Dems just sit there and take it? Can't they for once develop their own plans to countervail Republican machinations? All we ever hear from them is whining.

The Democratic Plan: Take back Congress!  Nothing will change until that happens.  Democratic control of Congress sounds great on paper but the harsh realities of gerrymandered voting districts favoring Republican candidates and a very polarized and angry electorate make this all but impossible for the foreseeable future.   There is also the matter of blue dog House and Senate Democrats who are just as likely to vote for Republican sponsored legislation in conservative areas of the country.
Look for a root cause behind most problems in this country and there is no doubt a cabal of Republicans making democracy a lot less democratic.

I don't know where you live, but our polling stations in my small city are still open. We have no mandatory requirement to vote by mail

In the 40 years I've lived in several cities in the San Francisco Bay Area I've usually been able to walk to block or mile to my polling place. I see many of the same poll workers and they recognize me. I sometimes choose to vote by mail if I'm going to be out of town or out of the country on business.

(btw, there isn't an election in California until June)

Fellow AZ voter, even if the mail-in ballot offers a convenient alternative to standing in line, voters (including myself) still prefers to go to a polling station and participate in our democracy through this medium. While waiting in line we were greater by activists, the media, and state legislatures championing their causes. But there is no excuse from the Arizona Election Commission for their incompetence in this. Cutting polling from 200 to 60 is an outrage. It took a national embarrassment for it to come to light the shadiness of our politics, and maybe we can see some movement to fair elections and a healthy debate on the current state of Arizona politics.

That is not correct. If you register as an Independent, you do NOT receive a ballot in "presidential preference" primaries unless you go through additional ridiculous processes to change your registration to R or D in time to receive an R or D ballot. MANY MANY registered Independents showed up at polling places in AZ to be told they were NOT eligible to vote. Since many independents are Sanders supporters, he lost thousands of votes in AZ.  I signed up for absentee ballots after almost being disenfranchised the second time I went to vote after moving to AZ in 2004. I had NOT been notified that my polling place had changed AND when I found the new polling place, they could not find my name on the list until I threw a total hissy fit. Despite being on the permanent mailing list, I call the voting registrar's office before EVERY election to make sure I am receiving the ballot and then call to be sure my signature was verified so my mailed-in vote was counted. There is NO REASON to trust voting in AZ no matter what county you reside in. The state is out to disenfranchise Democrats, independents, minorities, Latinos, and poor neighborhoods. It's corrupt and fighting to stay that way.

Voting is a 'privilege' in AZ ?

In a real democracy, voting is a right.

In many countries, e.g. Australia, it's a legally required duty.

Arizona DOES have early voting by mail in ballot. There is easy registration while at the MVD or even while accessing any of the state's official websites. Also, If you don't remove yourself from the roll, or lose your voting privilege you will be automatically registered and sent a ballot for all elections for which you are eligible to vote. I am frankly amazed that our republican controlled legislature enacted an early mail voting program as efficient and progressive as this is. Although counting the ballots... another issue entirely.
My wife had the same issue. If you're using the iPhone app, you need to navigate to your account settings and link your Apple ID (that's how you pay for it) with your NYTimes user ID.
The study is available to the public if you follow the link.

It would be interesting to see which of the four "pillars" were violated the most. For example, is it mostly being overweight, not exercising, etc or a combination that accounts for most people who fall short? Is any one more important than the other, for example smoking? I think I am pretty good with everything except possibly body fat. I would hope that is not as harmful as being a smoker but being good in the other categories. It would be good to have a breakdown of relative risks and percentages of people who fail in each particular category.

Correct. It was unlawful. The organizers gave themselves in to the police. Some were arrested during the 79 days. They will be prosecuted by the law willingly. So what is your problem. The Chinese communists had changed the basic law three times to impede the democratic reform of HK. It is more like playing chess with an opponent who  changes the rules as it goes along. Hong Kong should be returned to the Republic of China in Taiwan.
I think that the editor of the NYT puzzle needs to be edited with some of these recent arcane and inane products. Just do the grid.

The Democrats have the money to do what you suggest, but they seem to operate under a preconceived mix of messed up priorities. They lose not because they lack the issues but because they don't know how to use them. Yes, this is a lawsuit that should be brought be the Attorney General, and in her failure or refusal to do so, it should be brought by citizens proceeding in her name. It could also be brought or funded by the DNC, but the DNC lacks the leadership to do much of anything worthwhile. Hope your view gets through.
Best, Ed Spievack

If states can sue to have a hearing in the Supreme Court to dismantle the Voting Rights Act, why can't people sue the states claiming that they are being prohibited from voting? Why can't the people have their say in the courts to protect their rights that are being taken away from them by the states? Why is it wrong to make it difficult to vote because of race (or at least it used to be) but right to make it difficult to vote because of the neighborhood one lives in? Why can't the Democratic Party and left leaning super packs come up with the money to finance a herd of angry viscous lawyers to seek relief in the courts? How do Republicans get away with stunts like this? Since when does the Constitution only matter for some of the people? What could be a more obvious attack on voting rights?

When the Republicans continue the never ending series of investigations into Hillary's email, maybe they could squeeze one in on election commission corruption? That is, after they spend the next six months discussing the Biden Rule which doesn't even exist.

Republicans have become a wrecking crew. Their pronouncements and conduct is reminiscent of times past when the known world was controlled by fear and superstition, orthodoxy was more important than reason. Republicans have a total disregard for truth and logic. They are incapable or unwilling to participate in responsible governance.

The greater tragedy is there are millions of voters across the country who are accepting of the Republicans performance and will vote to for their continue membership in Congress.

Yet, I have hope this dance with the lunacy of the Republicans ends before this nation is reduced to a collection of brawling mobs fighting over the scrapes of our republic.

NR only did this when it was her ox being gored.

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/steven-conn/planned-parenthood-fetal_b_799...

"But it was President Ronald Reagan who first turned an important scientific pursuit into a political issue (masquerading as a moral crusade).

In his second term Reagan imposed a moratorium on federal funding for research that utilized fetal tissue because such tissue came from terminated fetuses. He, and others who supported his decision, made truly insulting assertions that medical research created a “market” for fetal tissue and thus would encourage women to 1) get pregnant in order to 2) have an abortion so that they could 3) sell the fetal tissue to make money. Revolting as such sentiments are, they are certainly revealing of the contempt Reagan and others had for women......So in 2004, desperate for the hope that medical research can provide (for RR who had Alzheimers), Nancy went to Capitol Hill to lobby for, yes, stem cell research. She even wrote a (public) letter to Bush begging him to allow stem cell research to go forward."
Would certainly eliminate a large number of candidates, especially this year. This idea could also lead to money savings as the overall size of congress would necessarily shrink.

Tell the truth here.  Cutting funding for Planned Parenthood is not just about ending a woman's right to choose.  The antichoice crowd led by Rep. Blackburn is anti-sex.  They not only want to end research (that could save lives...you know, living people), they want to make it harder for men and women to enjoy sexual relations that don't produce children.  They want to end use of contraceptives, and take us back to the good old days of morally upright America, where Mom and Dad had sex to have babies, period.  A fairytale world that someone made up in a church with a fairytale religion.  There ought to be a law alright, one that makes it illegal to run for office if you're crazy.
I hope that other readers will follow your example in writing or calling your representative.  You might remind them that elections are coming.

These are legitimate medical researchers including graduate students. Anti-abortion zealots have committed violence time and again against abortion clinics and doctors. They have bombed clinics and murdered the doctors. Recently people in the area were murdered by one of these zealots. This is not about naming and shaming: it is about creating a hit list for murder.

Harassment, bombings, shootings, intimidation - these are the tactics of the crazies who hate women so passionately. There is a very real risk that any names released will result in murder and violence.

And as the article points out, sometimes this results in a hit list for murder.  Look at how abortion clinics, doctors, and others in the vicinity have been bombed and shot or subjected to harassment.

This is evidence of the personal morals of these Republican congresspersons. They would deliberately endanger the lives of good American citizens.  It seems to go beyond simply not caring if they are physically endangered, it  appears they are actively and knowingly facilitating the danger.

Great suggestion.  This really deserves yuuge public and moral outrage for limiting scientific research into cures for human illnesses.  Blackburn and GOPers on this committee are the most ignorant of the ignorant when it comes to leadership, society, science, and progress, as if they were absolutely clueless about why we have such good medical care and advanced biological technology today.  Blackburn needs to hold hearings on the current state of bioscience to fight ignorance, including between her own ears.
